lead_paragraph: The presumptive Republican nominee cited the events in Nice, France, though Gov. Mike Pence is widely considered his likely choice.

byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn, Jonathan Martin, Alan Rappeport and Katie Shepherd contributed reporting.
byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS, MAGGIE HABERMAN and ASHLEY PARKER

headline.print_headline: Trump Delays Naming a No. 2, but Pence Appears No. 1 in Line
headline.main: Donald Trump Postpones Naming Running Mate

snippet: The presumptive Republican nominee cited the events in Nice, France, though Gov. Mike Pence is widely considered his likely choice....
abstract: Donald Trump abruptly postpones his announcement of pick for vice president, citing terrorist attack in Nice, France; Trump's campaign had signaled strongly that top candidate is Indiana Gov Mike Pence, but Trump has also insisted he has not made final decision.
